words.hint: A yellow fruit
A large animal with a trunk
A large landform that rises above the surrounding land
An electronic device for storing and processing data
A musical instrument with strings
A tall, yellow flower that follows the sun
A two-wheeled vehicle that you ride by pedaling
A round, flatbread topped with cheese, sauce, and various toppings
A vast body of saltwater that covers most of the Earth's surface
A written or printed work consisting of pages glued or sewn together along one side
A mythical creature typically depicted as a large, serpentine creature with wings and the ability to breathe fire
A woody perennial plant that typically has a single stem or trunk and bears lateral branches
A cylindrical projectile that can be propelled to a great height or distance by the combustion of its contents
A sweet, usually brown food preparation of roasted and ground cacao seeds
A team sport in which two teams, typically of five players each, compete to score points by shooting a ball through the opposing team's hoop
An arc of colors formed in the sky opposite the sun, caused by the refraction and dispersion of the sun's light by rain or other water droplets in the atmosphere
A powered flying vehicle with fixed wings and a weight greater than that of the air it displaces
The seed-bearing part of a plant, consisting of reproductive organs (stamens and carpels) that are typically surrounded by a brightly colored corolla
A system for transmitting voices over a distance using wire or radio, typically using a handset with a microphone and speaker
The natural satellite of the Earth, visible (chiefly at night) by reflected light from the sun
A road vehicle typically with four wheels, powered by an internal combustion engine and able to carry a small number of people
A domesticated carnivorous mammal that typically has a long snout, an acute sense of smell, and a barking, howling, or whining voice
A small domesticated carnivorous mammal with soft fur, a short snout, and retractile claws
The state of burning combustion, typically producing heat and light
An optical instrument for recording or capturing images
A connected series of railroad cars moved by a locomotive or by integral motors
A building for human habitation, especially one that is lived in by a family or small group of people
A large boat for transporting people or goods by sea
An instrument for writing or drawing with ink, typically consisting of a metal nib or ball, or a nylon tip, fitted into a metal or plastic holder
The round fruit of a tree of the rose family, which typically has thin red or green skin and crisp flesh
An instrument for measuring and indicating time, typically by hands on a round dial or by displayed figures
A large plant-eating domesticated mammal with solid hoofs and a flowing mane and tail, used for riding, racing, and to carry and pull loads
A game played by two teams of eleven players with a round ball that may not be touched with the hands or arms during play except by the goalkeeper
A small sweet cake, typically round, flat, and crisp
A narrow cylinder or strip of wood, graphite, or other material used for writing or drawing
A piece of furniture with a flat or sloped surface and typically with drawers, at which one can read, write, or do other work
An eight-legged predatory arachnid with an unsegmented body consisting of a fused head and thorax and a rounded abdomen
A machine capable of carrying out a complex series of actions automatically, especially one programmable by a computer
A covering for the foot, typically made of leather, having a sturdy sole and not reaching above the ankle
Vocal or instrumental sounds (or both) combined in such a way as to produce beauty of form, harmony, and expression of emotion
A pebbly or sandy shore, especially by the ocean between high- and low-water marks
A device for giving light, either one consisting of an electric bulb together with its holder
A hinged, sliding, or revolving barrier at the entrance to a building, room, or vehicle, or in the framework of a cupboard
An opening in the wall or roof of a building or vehicle, typically fitted with glass in a frame to admit light or air and allow people to see out
A reflective surface, now typically of glass coated with a metal amalgam, that reflects a clear image
A visible mass of condensed water vapor floating in the atmosphere, typically high above the ground
A piece of ground, often near a house, used for growing flowers, fruit, or vegetables
A separate seat for one person, typically with a back and four legs
A small piece of shaped metal with incisions cut to fit the wards of a particular lock, which is inserted into a lock and turned to open or close it
A pocket-sized, flat, folding holder for money and plastic cards
A shaped covering for the head, typically with a crown and brim
A covering for the hand worn for protection against cold or dirt and typically having separate parts for each finger and the thumb
A solid or hollow spherical or egg-shaped object that is kicked, thrown, or hit in a game
A round juicy citrus fruit with a tough bright reddish-yellow rind
A long curved fruit which grows in clusters and has soft pulpy flesh and yellow skin when ripe
A flightless bird native to New Zealand, with small wings, a long bill, and brown plumage
A sweet soft red fruit with a seed-studded surface
A large tropical fruit with a tough orange skin and sweet yellow flesh
A large melon with a hard green rind and sweet watery red or occasionally yellowish pulp
The large round fruit of a plant of the gourd family, with sweet pulpy flesh and many seeds
A sweet yellowish- or brownish-green edible fruit that is typically narrower and firmer than a peach, with juicy flesh
A berry, typically green (classified as white), purple, red, or black, growing in clusters on a grapevine, eaten as fruit, and used in making wine
A small sweet dark-blue fruit of a North American shrub, often found wild
A small, round stone fruit that is typically bright or dark red
A soft, round, smooth-skinned fruit with sweet flesh and a flattish pointed stone, especially a plum tree fruit
A juicy, soft fruit, resembling a small peach, of an orange-yellow color
A round, juicy fruit with sweet yellow flesh and downy pinkish-yellow skin
The round fruit of a tree of the rose family, which typically has thin red or green skin and crisp flesh
A glossy red, or occasionally yellow, pulpy edible fruit that is typically eaten as a vegetable or in salad
A leafy green vegetable used in salads and sandwiches
A long, green-skinned fruit with watery flesh, usually eaten raw in salads or pickled
A tapering orange-colored root eaten as a vegetable
An edible bulb with a pungent taste and smell, composed of several concentric layers, used in cooking
A starchy plant tuber that is one of the most important food crops, cooked and eaten as a vegetable
A strong-smelling pungent-tasting bulb, used as a flavoring in cooking and in herbal medicine
A cabbage of a variety similar to the cauliflower, bearing heads of green or purplish flower buds
A widely cultivated edible Asian plant of the goosefoot family, with large, dark green leaves that are eaten raw or cooked as a vegetable
A cultivated plant eaten as a vegetable, having thick green or purple leaves surrounding a spherical heart or head of young leaves
A long curved fruit which grows in clusters and has soft pulpy flesh and yellow skin when ripe
A small flightless bird native to New Zealand, with small wings and a long thin bill
A large flightless seabird of the southern hemisphere, with black upperparts and white underparts and wings developed into flippers for swimming
A flightless swift-running African bird with a long neck, long legs, and two toes on each foot
A brightly colored tropical bird with a curved bill and typically with the ability to mimic human speech
A tall wading bird with mainly pink or scarlet plumage and long legs and neck
A male domestic fowl, especially a young one
A waterbird with a broad blunt bill, short legs, webbed feet, and a waddling gait
A large mainly domesticated bird raised for its meat
A waterbird with a long neck, short legs, webbed feet, and a loud honking call
A small gregarious toothed whale that typically has a beaklike snout and a curved fin on the back
A very large marine mammal with a streamlined hairless body, a horizontal tail fin, and a blowhole on top of the head for breathing
A long-bodied chiefly marine fish with a cartilaginous skeleton, a prominent dorsal fin, and toothlike scales
A cephalopod mollusk with eight sucker-bearing arms, a soft sac-like body, strong beaklike jaws, and no internal shell
A free-swimming marine coelenterate with a jellylike bell- or saucer-shaped body that is typically transparent and has stinging tentacles around the edge
A small marine fish that has a prehensile tail, an elongated snout, and a head and neck suggestive of a horse
A large marine crustacean with a cylindrical body, stalked eyes, and the first of its five pairs of limbs modified as pincers
A marine crustacean with a broad carapace, stalked eyes, and five pairs of legs, the first of which are modified as pincers
A marine echinoderm with a somewhat star-shaped body and typically five arms, which radiate from a central disk
A slow-moving reptile with a shell into which it can retract its head and thick scaly skin
A tailless amphibian with a short squat body, moist smooth skin, and very long hind legs for leaping
A reptile that typically has a long body and tail, four legs, movable eyelids, and a rough scaly or spiny skin
A long limbless reptile that has no eyelids, a short tail, and jaws that are capable of considerable extension
A large predatory semiaquatic reptile with long jaws, long tail, short legs, and a horny textured skin
A very large solitary cat with a yellow-brown coat striped with black, native to the forests of Asia but becoming increasingly rare
A large tawny-colored cat that lives in prides, found in Africa and northwestern India. The male has a flowing shaggy mane and takes little part in hunting
A large solitary cat that has a fawn or brown coat with black spots, native to the forests of Africa and southern Asia
A large slender spotted cat found in Africa and parts of Asia. It is the fastest animal on land
A large, heavily built plant-eating mammal with one or two horns on the nose and thick folded skin, native to Africa and southern Asia
A heavy plant-eating mammal with a prehensile trunk, long curved ivory tusks, and large ears, native to Africa and southern Asia
A large thick-skinned semiaquatic African mammal, with massive jaws and large tusks. It is the third-largest living land mammal
A large African mammal with a very long neck and forelegs, having a coat patterned with brown patches separated by lighter lines
An African wild horse with black-and-white stripes and an erect mane
A large plant-eating marsupial with a long powerful tail and strongly developed hind limbs that enable it to travel by leaping
A bearlike arboreal Australian marsupial that has thick gray fur and feeds on eucalyptus leaves
A large bearlike mammal with characteristic black and white markings, native to certain mountain forests of central and western China. It feeds almost entirely on bamboo
A wild carnivorous mammal of the dog family, living and hunting in packs. It is native to both Eurasia and North America
A carnivorous mammal of the dog family with a pointed muzzle and bushy tail, proverbial for its cunning
A large, heavy mammal with thick fur and a very short tail. Bears are omnivorous, and they hibernate in winter
A small to medium-sized primate that typically has a long tail, most kinds of which live in trees in tropical countries
The largest living primate, a heavily built, ground-dwelling ape with a large head, short neck, and broad chest
A large primate that lacks a tail, including the gorilla, chimpanzees, orangutan, and gibbons
A burrowing, gregarious, plant-eating mammal with long ears, long hind legs, and a short tail
An agile tree-dwelling rodent with a bushy tail, typically feeding on nuts and seeds
A small Eurasian rodent typically kept as a pet or used in scientific research
A rodent that resembles a large mouse, typically having a pointed snout and a long, sparsely haired tail
A small rodent with pointed snout, rounded ears, and a long, scaly tail
A burrowing rodent with fur-lined pouches on the outside of the cheeks, found in North and Central America
A mainly nocturnal mammal capable of sustained flight, with membranous wings
A nocturnal bird of prey with large forward-facing eyes surrounded by facial disks, a hooked beak, and typically a loud call
A large bird of prey with a massive hooked bill and long broad wings, known for its keen sight and powerful soaring flight
A bird of prey with broad rounded wings and a long tail, typically taking prey by surprise with a short chase
A bird of prey with long pointed wings and a notched beak, typically catching prey by diving on it from above
A large bird of prey with a bald head and mainly black plumage, feeding chiefly on carrion
A large heavily built crow with mainly black plumage, feeding chiefly on carrion
A small brownish or grayish bird with a short bill and typically a melodious song, feeding chiefly on seeds
A large waterbird with a long flexible neck, short legs, webbed feet, a broad bill, and typically all-white plumage
A large flightless seabird of the southern hemisphere, with black upperparts and white underparts and wings developed into flippers for swimming
A large flightless swift-running African bird with a long neck, long legs, and two toes on each foot
A brightly colored tropical bird with a curved bill and typically with the ability to mimic human speech
A tall wading bird with mainly pink or scarlet plumage and long legs and neck
A male domestic fowl, especially a young one
A waterbird with a broad blunt bill, short legs, webbed feet, and a waddling gait
